Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy when it has water, showing how water helps it grow.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy or wilting when it lacks water, showing the effects of not having enough water.
The student can include different types of lines or shapes to represent water and its absence (e.g., raindrops, a dry, cracked ground).
The student can show a comparison by drawing two plants side by side – one with water and one without – to highlight the differences in growth and health.
The student can use colors to represent a vibrant, healthy plant versus a dull, unhealthy plant to illustrate the impact of water.
